title: Early Language and Literacy
subject: Preschool Early Learning and Development Standards (2024-)

document.title: Preschool - Maine's Early Learning and Development Standards

B4830E3F9C254BE6BA227A793D59F520.description:
Gathers and recalls
information from multiple
sources.

7633C532C06F45698E90982A8CE56AAB.description:
Acquires information
about a topic through
research as modeled by
adults.

2EE1035C9F0D4016AA4B2A73C810C813.description:
With guidance and support
from adults, begins to
recall some information
from experiences or gather
information from resources.

074EF93A4A1245F686CA778911C6961D.description:
Begins to participate in
shared research and writing
projects modeled by adults
(e.g., community helpers).

4BBA8985D32148F98D4D430BFBC7C9BB.description:
Inquiry to Build and Present
Knowledge

7B732FD27EFD4B3EAABDA75E922184EE.description:
Begins to use digital tools
to produce messages with pictures and words
to communicate to an
audience.

5389FCEEE26D49CE9D0FBEDD373F3D75.description:
Shares drawing and
writing with others and
is prepared to give and
receive feedback with
peers.

0BF6D301EE7C400F83DEFB08D9D5FCFF.description:
Collaborates to plan and
develop a message to
share with others.

703A878ADE7942168D7F87B92AB8FC5A.description:
recognizes that digital
tools are used for
communication and, with
support and guidance,
uses them to convey
messages in picture and/or
words

5C62524C66CC43ACA1ECE96A1549812B.description:
shares drawing and writing
with others

B0BF574A942E45BBA37CCAD2E623C9C2.description:
Begins to spell simple words
phonetically, drawing on
knowledge of sound-letter
relationships.

D84F5919418746148A6EED915AD06DA9.description:
Begins to write letters to
represent sounds.

984988D20E7A441489B292D91549B399.description:
Capitalizes the first letter
in their own name.

978865C560834F4C961B0C6BA7B764C6.description:
Begins to demonstrate the
use of standardized English
capitalization, punctuation,
and spelling when writing:

36B572F42DEE43748DAFDAED2E103EC0.description:
Prints some upper and
lowercase letters.

D7D8211612B94034AE8FC544469E050A.description:
Communicates opinions
on topics of interest

4FDF12DAB2CF4268946C1E5D14E0EE6B.description:
With prompting and support,
uses a combination of
drawing, dictating and
writing to:

D82B455B0E284C968DB7CAC04AA2DE9C.description:
With prompting and
support, uses a combination
of drawing, dictating
and emergent writing to
communicate ideas.

72E7B3BAA23848DA8206654592A1D96D.description:
Writing: explore a variety of texts and ideas in order to acquire skills needed to write letters and words, comprehend grammar and sentence
structure, and cultivate the capacity to communicate ideas and feelings through written language.

05105D411959476ABC86DF91FD2D2B24.description:
Imitates fluent models of
reading using phrasing,
intonation and expression
during shared and choral
reading of familiar books,
poems, or nursery rhymes.

6D673B719074422898C018B4888CA267.description:
Attends to fluent models of
reading.

6E99251AABE041C0AAC16C2BFB9FC48B.description:
Begins to imitate fluent
models of reading (e.g.,
initiates “reading” a book
after hearing it read out loud).

E3AC83E98E5A4C9A89E57BFF6CD3410A.description:
Attends to fluent models of
reading.

F040CBD186014B24870ABA999BC0C85C.description:
Represents or acts out
concepts learned from
hearing a text read aloud
(e.g., makes a skyscraper out
of blocks, pretends to be a
character in a story).

E92C1D1691044ACBAA10EB266BBC2642.description:
With prompting and support,
describes important
information from text and
pictures/photos/graphics,
and begin to compare similarities and differences
between two texts on the
same topic.

2B8305B381CA4339AAF23C7A1836D31B.description:
Recognizes that information
on a topic can be found in
more than one text.

2A04018A49C141408DB4776E904662CC.description:
Begins to make connections
between characters and
events in familiar stories.

A3C611BD4A964032ACE55679FF97F58E.description:
Retells familiar stories using
both storybook language and
pictures.

CBC6127E3C3141F6A4EB5680F6A476C9.description:
Actively engages with texts
read aloud for understanding
and enjoyment.

E56668AE3D2744ED8DF552089B904E1F.description:
Retells familiar stories or
make up personal stories
with words approximating
storybook language.

22D97629507F4DC78CA18085FB45520C.description:
Begins to make connections
between a story or poem and one’s own experiences
(e.g., acts out a familiar story
during dramatic play with
props).

68C48696999248CC8237B687DA40644A.description:
Seeks out experiences
(individually and in groups)
with pictures, books, and
other print materials (e.g.,
asks for a favorite story to be
read again).

2AAD00719E4442AA81689187E6EC4789.description:
Begins to describe the roles
of authors and illustrators.

D5215BF0EE134A3F860A65DC11DF9AD7.description:
With prompting and support,
identifies texts that provide
information.

4993789236064B3CB16032158D6443B8.description:
With prompting and support,
identifies texts that tell
stories.

2BC2D9DE722A47DB923665B7EC552AFA.description:
Begins to demonstrate
an understanding of the
difference between fiction and nonfiction.

71DF0034BFCD49C88F6D5C37C6E59F70.description:
Begins to recognize that there
are different text structures,
such as stories, poems, and
songs.

009CC81D07BE4E838E46B033BD50C12C.description:
Asks questions about
unknown words and phrases
in stories and informational
texts read aloud or shared
visually.

B318127C54F741C68B95CA2DD601A246.description:
Begin to understand that a
book has a title, author and
illustrator.

765FD606E2EC40A98949C286B626CD43.description:
Make observations about
words and pictures in books.

03ADDB6C29B44A60A5861108BF141AC0.description:
Makes predictions about
what events might happen
next.

4697281B5F1E4AD39FD95DD8B581E175.description:
Begins to notice connections
between characters and
events in a story.

12E14333E1C14E96863F0FBE89B28F6F.description:
Recalls important facts from
an informational text that
is read aloud or by studying
particular pages/visuals of
the text.

216259690F4B40229DA4E307B16BA8C3.description:
Identifies characters,
settings, and major events
in a story.

EBD58A1C53E9469F8889B85243B71086.description:
Actively participates in
discussions about the
illustrations, diagrams,
and other visual forms of
information.

B3B004DF409143DC894B60E3B5E533D5.description:
Asks and answers
questions about simple
stories and informational
text read aloud.

87887805031C42169BC768849B3E5027.description:
Actively engages with
texts read aloud for
understanding and
enjoyment.

8239F921F57A4DA7B24D65550731CF63.description:
Identifies the topic of an
informational text read aloud.

3268B7D3A1104BA0A0F5AF7762775CC1.description:
Recalls important facts from
an informational text read
aloud.

9BE9688E46604056839E72C049E27582.description:
Retells information about
a character or an event in
a simple story that is read
aloud.

604077CFD446459190ADCAE936DCD636.description:
Demonstrates
understanding of whom or
what a story is about.

5D912A11530742F283EA6CB867E315D0.description:
Participates in discussions
about the illustrations,
diagrams, and other visual
forms of information.

A7965B203A8F4E669E24EAA216AB03DB.description:
Begins to ask and answer
questions about simple
stories and informational
text read aloud.

6053B6793B934C63B4F318AF9FA289CC.description:
Begins to actively engage
with texts read aloud
for understanding and
enjoyment.

9ACA9D3A80D14F5DB43922BF748553BC.description:
With prompting and support
applies beginning phonics
and word analysis skills.

221576124E5A4C88B894C33F647FDB3B.description:
Recognizes names of other
children in the classroom and
common print around the
classroom.

542B7D773CCB448588FF71D04CA03781.description:
Begins to link a sound to
a picture of an object that
begins with that sound.

DE6C55A1AAEA432288FA6F75BB165361.description:
Produces the sounds
associated with several recognized letters.

70C8D3805DAB436CA7627B25890201AE.description:
Begins to recognize common
print around the classroom.

AC392838EBA643D7A46529337FBB2B78.description:
Begins to recognize their own
name and the names of other
children in the classroom.

3E07F2CDAFBF4E248235CD8298E5C38D.description:
Begin to link a sound to
some familiar printed letters.

0441486219434DFB90A6B0E9A64ED94D.description:
Begin to recognize that
letters represent sounds.

38B29B0DDACB4CF49BAD57153F6787FA.description:
Begins to add or substitute
initial sounds (i.e. phonemes)
in single-syllable CVC words
to make new words (e.g., cat,
hat, sat; pig, wig, big).

9DAAC6AE8EBD423FBFC07096CC8018F1.description:
Isolates and identifies
the initial sounds (i.e.
phonemes) in single-syllable words and in their
own name.

CBBB5FEED6664B768EE5D7FC5C218749.description:
Blends and segments
onsets and rimes in single-syllable words.

AC8DCF2888D24529B93C0CB2982DDEAD.description:
Counts, blends, and
segments syllables in
words.

B9D613EB42B5416E82DFE4F47037EB03.description:
Demonstrates understanding
of words, syllables, and
sounds (i.e. phonemes).

123FABB331CA493398A3C39EF8F76063.description:
Begins to count, pronounce,
blend, and segment syllables
in their own names.

F0598F767390461287C019461770E049.description:
With support, begins to
recognize when two words
start with the same sound.

B2896D88B472433696C5558352633632.description:
With support, begins to
recognize when two words
rhyme.

1B8409B99CDF48B2A9C25D5213690841.description:
Demonstrates enjoyment
of rhyme and alliteration in
nursery rhymes and simple
stories.

8423E76CE12444F5A96ADB431F237BE6.description:
Demonstrates an
understanding of spoken
words and syllables.

492CE1F046544483915ECAF1A99C7EF3.description:
Recognizes and names at
least 15 upper case and 15
lower case letters, including
the letters in their own name.

AFC69BD4C757427DBDB380B67A4F8A97.description:
Recognizes that printed
words represent spoken
language and carry meaning.

3DF50FCF11C5466BBE189E401FCF16C9.description:
Understands that words are
separated by spaces in print.

1ABF1E2E55B04B149854FD0B84A14C72.description:
Follows words from left to
right and top to bottom.

E9162C3DE03345C5A7F8A0B8498E329B.description:
Holds the book correctly for
reading and turn one page at
a time.

85E5C9CE9AFB45F0BBAD2F62B5B5410E.description:
Identifies parts of a book
including, front cover, back
cover, and title.

D0D942C5E87348C3AD0A6B2845988C99.description:
Demonstrates understanding
of the organization and basic
features of print.

263FCDAB2BB74153B4A18077AE56AEC6.description:
Begins to recognize and
name letters in their own
name.

82C12B6DC590438EB500D6D489485D85.description:
Begins to show awareness of
alphabet letters.

B6CF310453D54222B755EA6F8CC1EFA4.description:
Recognizes that print
represents spoken words and
carries meaning (e.g., asks an
adult “What does this say?”).

45B5B8CE21FE4F20BBF25FFC438E78B8.description:
Begins to hold a book
correctly, turn pages in a
single direction, and follow a
story from left to right.

8875ADF18D8D4D6687E696B4370AED57.description:
Begins to display appropriate
book-handling behaviors.

918B39D4834242DDB250FAEF02231A19.description:
Foundations of Early Literacy: to understand and develop a working knowledge of concepts of print, the alphabetic principle, phonological/phonemic awareness,
phonics and word recognition, and other basic conventions including the exploration of various genres of text.

660FC46B675D440485D9048AAB587AF2.description:
Sorts common objects into
categories (e.g., big/small,
living/nonliving).

EB9166B846CD4FB1BF330F41FAEA4B13.description:
With guidance and support
from adults, uses words and
phrases acquired through
conversations, listening to
books read aloud, activities, and play.

8AD769A07E6C4C018763958B83C6771D.description:
With guidance and support
from adults, begins to
demonstrate understanding
of frequently occurring verbs
and adjectives by relating
them to their opposites.

0BCF146FDB97479E9882EE8777A116AA.description:
With guidance, prompting
and support, begins to
generate words that are
similar in meaning (e.g.,
happy/glad, angry/mad).

562512B0A3CA43EF8EA4F65EF17CD4A2.description:
Asks and answers questions
about the meaning of
unknown words and phrases
introduced through books
and play.

91362008781945878F2D19C08C6F9FFB.description:
With guidance and support
from adults, begins to
sort common objects into
categories (e.g., big/small,
living/nonliving).

46CB41BF8841457399E85E224DF395E8.description:
With guidance and support
from adults, begins to apply
words learned in classroom
activities to real-life examples
(e.g., names the places in
school that are fun, quiet, or
noisy).

611B2D2B75DF4A25ADF4AF03224A54C4.description:
With guidance and support
from adults, begins to explore
word relationships and
meanings.

2E4273D5ABFA4A5EA99286B848B7511F.description:
Begins to ask and answer
questions about the
meanings of new words and
phrases introduced through
books, activities, and play.

FC07C9AD609C48FEB7FBB7914F8292F4.description:
Begins to use knowledge of language and its conventions
when relaying messages or
listening for comprehension.

9C15BBD080974BA29481C7FE3A4CE332.description:
Responds to and use
more question words/
interrogatives (e.g. who,
what, where, when, why,
how).

E70B7BE2F2914F51854044F0A7CB4C8C.description:
Understands the most
frequently occurring
prepositions (e.g. to, from, in,
out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

1F34411FF6E04CB1B26085D972C92AC4.description:
Forms some regular plural
nouns orally by adding /s/
or /es? (e.g. dog, dogs; wish,
wishes).

31A098D8F6E34824B407D76EE220FF84.description:
Uses frequently occurring
nouns and verbs.

8F7539B8C21A421B805862FC40433AD9.description:
Demonstrates the ability to
communicate using spoken
language, sign, or other
augmentative or alternative
communication in complete
sentences.

3465AA5807D1473E8AD70407FDE84C52.description:
Begins to speak in complete
sentences.

772CB480899249EAB6E7570F1E7AE3E3.description:
Begins to understand
question words (e.g. who,
what, where, when, why,
how).

E07F0895E08845F1B77A9416180E6A5F.description:
Begins to understand and use
the most frequently occurring
prepositions (e.g. to, from, in,
out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

FEB561F98A1A4A7A94299B70117FB45E.description:
Begins to form some regular
plural nouns orally by adding
/s/ or /es? (e.g. dog, dogs;
wish, wishes).

181D898E73D141AE8C6D8891507E968F.description:
Begins to use frequently
occurring nouns and verbs.

F4468C77F63C4C21B8CF30B0E69433D5.description:
Begins to demonstrate
understanding of the
conventions of standard
English grammar and usage
when speaking.

E91B05EA29C343FB983362A933D66F5A.description: Knowledge of Language: understand the system of rules and principles that governs the English language and how language functions in different contexts.

80C6440E9C664C3183CE31121E1E1002.description:
With modeling and support
from adults, uses language
(i.e. spoken, sign, or other
augmentative or alternative
communication) to express
thoughts, feelings, and ideas
clearly.

E2E6C149E4A7431F87C3770A048649BA.description:
With modeling and support
from adults, uses drawings,
or other visual displays to add
details to verbal descriptions.

B54A3B767C774506867F39D24C37F0CF.description:
With guidance and support
from adults, begins to speak
audibly to express thoughts,
feelings, and ideas.

73473BB47DCA4B958F431D79D907B6C9.description:
With guidance and support
from adults, begins to add
drawings or other visual
displays to provide additional
detail.

B3D4D8097EB14E1CB0BEAC792132544B.description:
Begins to describe familiar
people, places, things, and
events.

92CC57D8660D4E8DA67D524EC35B30AE.description:
Asks questions in order to
seek help, gather information,
or clarify something that is not understood.

9F35AAB1B07F400794A8AACE08CC5B10.description:
Confirms understanding
of a text read aloud, or
information presented orally,
or through other media
by asking and answering
questions.

53705E1641DE47ED8BCC7BB1C77D838B.description:
With modeling and support,
continues a conversation
through multiple exchanges.

84D84439BC60482483DE274A761C2A84.description:
With modeling and
support, follows classroom
expectations for discussions
(e.g., listen to others, take
turns speaking about the
topic under discussion).

9A3473EF3EBC44C5B376B6BCB157F50C.description:
Uses language to engage in
collaborative conversations
about preschool topics and
texts with peers and adults.

A6B77429190C4809AFC15D7C19BC9699.description:
Begins to ask questions in
order to seek help, gather
information, or clarify
something that is not
understood.

D8D878B527A64E46AFBE7529529A8BB0.description:
Begins to confirm
understanding of a text
read aloud, or information
presented orally, or through
other media by asking and
answering questions.

1E82C97FE5E14D7891277A8FAE35A433.description:
Begins to engage in
conversations with multiple
exchanges.

4CB0C50F9E33435B84C0C79577949B17.description:
Begins to follow agreed-upon rules for discussions
(e.g., listening to others and
taking turns speaking about
the topics and texts under
discussion).

A01E95E5D0E541CE8E6695D34B17BC91.description:
Begins to engage in
collaborative conversations
about preschool topics and
texts with peers and adults in
small and larger groups.

756A54403DA947E6AA171F8CA642A0F7.description:
Speaking and Listening: prepare for and participate in conversations across a range of topics, types, and forums, building on others’ ideas and expressing their
own.
